string-array.name: generalWorryStatement
string-array.item: I can\'t predict the future, so there is no point in guessing.
I don\'t have to believe everything I think.
Don\'t assume the worst - it usually does\'nt happen.
Even if something bad happens, I can handle it.
Instead of worrying about problems, I can take action to solve them.
When my mind goes to the future, I\'ll bring it back to the present.
I can\'t control everything, so there is no need to try so hard.
Learning to sit with some uncertainty will help me worry less.

string-array.name: socialAnxietyStatement
string-array.item: I don\'t know what others are thinking, so I need to stop guessing.
People are more concerned about themselves than me.
I don\'t need to be perfect to be liked.
Even if people notice I\'m anxious, it doesn\'t mean they\'ll think less of me.
I\'m not responsible for the whole conversation.
I don\'t always need to be interesting and entertaining.
Not everyone needs to like me. Do I necessarily like everyone I meet?
The people who really matter will accept me the way I am.

string-array.name: panicStatement
string-array.item: My body is just reacting to a "false alarm" - there isn\'t any real danger.
Panic attacks are uncomfortable, bur nor dangerous.
Panic attacks will not make me faint, go crazy, lose control, or die.
Others won\'t necessarily be able to tell I\'m having a panic attack.
If I have a panic attack, I just need to ride out the wave.
Panic attacks won\'t last forever. These feelings will end.
When I avoid things because of panic, I\'m feeding my anxiety.
Every panic attack is an opportunity to master my anxiety.

string-array.name: phobiaStatement
string-array.item: I don\'t have to assume the worst - it usually doesn\'t happen.
I can\'t always trust what anxiety is telling me.
Feeling like something is dangerous doesn\'t mean it really is dangerous.
Facing the things that scare me is the best way to overcome anxiety.
The more I face what I\'m afraid of, the easier it becomes.
The cost of avoiding my fear is greater than the risk of facing it.
The goal is to do things despite my anxiety.
This is manageable, tolerable and survivable.
